thread.title: ​Allegiant Air to add three new destinations by year’s end
thread.title_full: ​Allegiant Air to add three new destinations by year’s end

author: Eric Snider
title: ​Allegiant Air to add three new destinations by year’s end
text:
Allegiant Air Allegiant Air continues to carve out a bigger piece of the PIE. The budget airline announced Tuesday it had added three more nonstop routes at St. Pete-Clearwater International Airport (PIE): Appleton, Wisconsin, 30 miles southwest of Green Bay, beginning Nov. 6. Scranton, Pennsylvania, in the northeast part of the state, starting Nov. 6. Kansas City, Missouri, which kicks off Nov. 12. The new additions bring the total Allegiant destinations at PIE to 47, making it one of the airline's busiest hubs. It also continues to consolidate the carrier’s dominance at the airport. Allegiant (NASDAQ: ALGT) accounts for roughly 95 percent of the passenger traffic at PIE. The airline is driving record growth at the airport. According to numbers released August 10, PIE accommodated 173,743 passengers in July, a 50 percent leap from the same month last year. Year-to-date, passenger traffic is up 31 percent from 2014 — with a total, 1,003,016, that cracks seven figures with just seven months gone. Last year’s tally, a record, was 1,247,987.
